wikipedia_page.main: Edward Maurice Watkins CBE (30 November 1941 – 16 August 2021) was a British solicitor and sports administrator best known as being a long-time director and the club solicitor of Manchester United. He had represented high-profile clients in criminal trials including Eric Cantona and Stuart Hall.After leaving Manchester United, he served in multiple other sports administration roles including as chairman of British Swimming, overseeing the team's successful Rio 2016 and Tokyo 2020 Olympic cycles. He was joint senior partner of Brabners LLP solicitors in Manchester.

link_mentions.page: List of people associated with University College London
response: * Maurice Watkins (LLB, LLM), Director of Manchester United's football board and club's solicitor

In 1983, Edwards had begun looking for younger colleagues to introduce to the club's board. Sir Matt Busby had been appointed president of the club and Michael Edelson was appointed to replace him on the board by Edwards, followed in June 1984 by the addition of club solicitor Maurice Watkins and club legend Bobby Charlton.
* Maurice Watkins (solicitor) (born 1941), British solicitor and football club administrator

link_mentions.page: Swimming at the 2014 Commonwealth Games – Women's 4 × 100 metre freestyle relay
response: The medals were presented by Maurice Watkins, Chairman of British Swimming and the quaichs were presented by Denise Holmes, Emirates' Sales Manager for Scotland and North East England.
On 31 August 2017, Barnsley released a statement to announce that the club's chairman Maurice Watkins CBE was leaving the role as chairman and the board of Barnsley Football Club.
Club Statement. Maurice Watkins CBE Barnsley Football Club, official Website.   Retrieved 31 August 2017.
